name: CapStmtAdminService
title: CapStmt Admin Service
publisher: HL7 International / Community Based Collaborative Care

contact.name: HL7 International / Community Based Collaborative Care

statement.label: requirement-1
statement.requirement:
Consent Administration Service SHALL implement the server CapabilityStatement

Does this mean a conforming system has to reference the "requirements" CS here, or could they just have their own CS that happens to be compatible? Also, what test should this be traced to? I'm thinking this traces to test procedure that ensures the right complement of tests are applied to a given system.

statement.label: requirement-2
statement.requirement:
Consent Administration Service SHALL support JSON FHIR

- Plan is to have JSON and XML flavors of all tests, but explicitly tracing each of those back to these requirements is probably not necessary.

statement.label: requirement-34
statement.requirement:
Consent Administration Service SHALL support XML FHIR

- Plan is to have JSON and XML flavors of all tests, but explicitly tracing each of those back to these requirements is probably not necessary.

statement.label: requirement-43
statement.requirement: Consent Administration Service SHALL support Consent resource

statement.label: requirement-35
statement.requirement: Consent Administration Service SHALL support Consent resources that conform to FASTConsent profile

statement.label: requirement-331
statement.requirement:
Consent Administration Service SHALL mark with profile assertions Consent resources that conform to the FASTConsent profile

Base FHIR requirement, applies because of declaring supportedProfile. Not marking as fully tested because I will continue to need to trace this to every transaction that applies.

statement.label: requirement-332
statement.requirement:
Consent Administration Service SHALL support searching by the _profile parameter for Consent resources that conform to the FASTConsent profile

Base FHIR requirement, applies because of declaring supportedProfile

statement.label: requirement-503
statement.requirement:
Consent Administration Service SHOULD support Subscription write via POST or PUT

- "After POSTing the subscription, the client parses the Location header and saves the new Subscription's logical id for use in subsequent operations." - implies server should always return Location
